New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder's undefeated streak is intact, and they are 4-0 for the first time since the 2016-17 season
Key Match Events: Wembanyama limped to the locker room after seemingly injuring his foot during a post-up in the second quarter
The Thunder took advantage after Wembanyama went down, with Holmgren scoring seven points during a 14-7 run
A 9-2 Oklahoma City run put the hosts in control once again
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: There are no post-match reflections mentioned in the article
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder made a season-high 17 three-pointers, including 13 before halftime
Oklahoma City also tallied a season-best 28 assists
Opponents are averaging 94.75 points per game against Oklahoma City
The Thunder racked up 18 steals and converted 22 San Antonio turnovers into 27 points
Others: Harrison Barnes led San Antonio with 18 points, while Jeremy Sochan added 17 points and nine rebounds
Wembanyama has been held to fewer than 10 points four times in his first 75 career games, with two of those instances occurring against Oklahoma City
